intro: Cryptantha sericea var. typica, commonly known as the silky cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, blue to violet flowers. The plant produces delicate, silky-tasseled seed heads that are distinctive and often used in ornamental gardening. It thrives in well-drained soils and is typically found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Cryptantha sericea var. typica is a perennial species that blooms in late spring to early summer.
